intro: Goebelia pachycarpa, commonly known as the thick-fruited goebelia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces large, fleshy fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Goebelia pachycarpa is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
